name: HIPAA
description: Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act - Privacy Rule and Security Rule requirements for protecting Protected Health Information (PHI) and Electronic Protected Health Information (ePHI).
source: U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS)

requirements.title: Administrative Safeguards
requirements.description: Administrative actions, policies, and procedures to manage the selection, development, implementation, and maintenance of security measures to protect ePHI.

children.title: Security Management Process
children.description: Implement policies and procedures to prevent, detect, contain, and correct security violations.

children.title: Risk Analysis
children.description: Conduct an accurate and thorough assessment of the potential risks and vulnerabilities to the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of ePHI.

children.title: Risk Management
children.description: Implement security measures sufficient to reduce risks and vulnerabilities to a reasonable and appropriate level.

children.title: Sanction Policy
children.description: Apply appropriate sanctions against workforce members who fail to comply with security policies and procedures.

children.title: Information System Activity Review
children.description: Implement procedures to regularly review records of information system activity, such as audit logs, access reports, and security incident tracking reports.

children.title: Assigned Security Responsibility
children.description: Identify the security official who is responsible for the development and implementation of the policies and procedures.

children.title: Workforce Security
children.description: Implement policies and procedures to ensure that all members of its workforce have appropriate access to ePHI and to prevent unauthorized access.

children.title: Authorization and/or Supervision
children.description: Implement procedures for the authorization and/or supervision of workforce members who work with ePHI.

children.title: Workforce Clearance Procedure
children.description: Implement procedures to determine that the access of a workforce member to ePHI is appropriate.

children.title: Termination Procedures
children.description: Implement procedures for terminating access to ePHI when the employment of a workforce member ends.

children.title: Information Access Management
children.description: Implement policies and procedures for authorizing access to ePHI that are consistent with the applicable requirements.

children.title: Isolating Healthcare Clearinghouse Functions
children.description: If a healthcare clearinghouse is part of a larger organization, the clearinghouse must implement policies and procedures that protect ePHI from unauthorized access by the larger organization.

children.title: Access Authorization
children.description: Implement policies and procedures for granting access to ePHI, for example, through access to a workstation, transaction, program, process, or other mechanism.

children.title: Access Establishment and Modification
children.description: Implement policies and procedures that, based upon the entity's access authorization policies, establish, document, review, and modify a user's right of access to a workstation, transaction, program, or process.

children.title: Security Awareness and Training
children.description: Implement a security awareness and training program for all members of its workforce.

children.title: Security Reminders
children.description: Periodic security updates.

children.title: Protection from Malicious Software
children.description: Procedures for guarding against, detecting, and reporting malicious software.

children.title: Log-in Monitoring
children.description: Procedures for monitoring log-in attempts and reporting discrepancies.

children.title: Password Management
children.description: Procedures for creating, changing, and safeguarding passwords.

children.title: Security Incident Procedures
children.description: Implement policies and procedures to address security incidents.

children.title: Response and Reporting
children.description: Identify and respond to suspected or known security incidents; mitigate, to the extent practicable, harmful effects of security incidents that are known to the covered entity; and document security incidents and their outcomes.

children.title: Contingency Plan
children.description: Establish policies and procedures for responding to an emergency or other occurrence that damages systems that contain ePHI.

children.title: Data Backup Plan
children.description: Establish and implement procedures to create and maintain retrievable exact copies of ePHI.

children.title: Disaster Recovery Plan
children.description: Establish and implement procedures to restore any loss of data.

children.title: Emergency Mode Operation Plan
children.description: Establish and implement procedures to enable continuation of critical business processes for protection of ePHI while operating in emergency mode.

children.title: Testing and Revision Procedures
children.description: Implement procedures for periodic testing and revision of contingency plans.

children.title: Applications and Data Criticality Analysis
children.description: Assess the relative criticality of specific applications and data in support of other contingency plan components.

children.title: Evaluation
children.description: Perform a periodic technical and nontechnical evaluation that establishes the extent to which an entity's security policies and procedures meet the requirements.

children.title: Business Associate Contracts
children.description: A covered entity may permit a business associate to create, receive, maintain, or transmit ePHI on the covered entity's behalf only if the covered entity obtains satisfactory assurances.

children.title: Written Contract or Other Arrangement
children.description: Document the satisfactory assurances required by the business associate contracts standard through a written contract or other arrangement.

requirements.title: Physical Safeguards
requirements.description: Physical measures, policies, and procedures to protect electronic information systems and related buildings and equipment from natural and environmental hazards and unauthorized intrusion.

children.title: Facility Access Controls
children.description: Implement policies and procedures to limit physical access to its electronic information systems and the facility or facilities in which they are housed.

children.title: Contingency Operations
children.description: Establish and implement procedures that allow facility access in support of restoration of lost data under the disaster recovery plan and emergency mode operations plan.

children.title: Facility Security Plan
children.description: Implement policies and procedures to safeguard the facility and the equipment therein from unauthorized physical access, tampering, and theft.

children.title: Access Control and Validation Procedures
children.description: Implement procedures to control and validate a person's access to facilities based on their role or function.

children.title: Maintenance Records
children.description: Implement policies and procedures to document repairs and modifications to the physical components of a facility which are related to security.

children.title: Workstation Use
children.description: Implement policies and procedures that specify the proper functions to be performed, the manner in which those functions are to be performed, and the physical attributes of the surroundings of a specific workstation.

children.title: Workstation Security
children.description: Implement physical safeguards for all workstations that access ePHI, to restrict access to authorized users.

children.title: Device and Media Controls
children.description: Implement policies and procedures that govern the receipt and removal of hardware and electronic media that contain ePHI into and out of a facility.

children.title: Disposal
children.description: Implement policies and procedures to address the final disposition of ePHI and/or the hardware or electronic media on which it is stored.

children.title: Media Re-use
children.description: Implement procedures for removal of ePHI from electronic media before the media are made available for re-use.

children.title: Accountability
children.description: Maintain a record of the movements of hardware and electronic media and any person responsible therefore.

children.title: Data Backup and Storage
children.description: Create a retrievable, exact copy of ePHI, when needed, before movement of equipment.

requirements.title: Technical Safeguards
requirements.description: The technology and the policy and procedures for its use that protect ePHI and control access to it.

children.title: Access Control
children.description: Implement technical policies and procedures for electronic information systems that maintain ePHI to allow access only to those persons or software programs that have been granted access rights.

children.title: Unique User Identification
children.description: Assign a unique name and/or number for identifying and tracking user identity.

children.title: Emergency Access Procedure
children.description: Establish and implement procedures for obtaining necessary ePHI during an emergency.

children.title: Automatic Logoff
children.description: Implement electronic procedures that terminate an electronic session after a predetermined time of inactivity.

children.title: Encryption and Decryption
children.description: Implement a mechanism to encrypt and decrypt ePHI.

children.title: Audit Controls
children.description: Implement hardware, software, and/or procedural mechanisms that record and examine activity in information systems that contain or use ePHI.

children.title: Integrity
children.description: Implement policies and procedures to protect ePHI from improper alteration or destruction.

children.title: Mechanism to Authenticate ePHI
children.description: Implement electronic mechanisms to corroborate that ePHI has not been altered or destroyed in an unauthorized manner.

children.title: Person or Entity Authentication
children.description: Implement procedures to verify that a person or entity seeking access to ePHI is the one claimed.

children.title: Transmission Security
children.description: Implement technical security measures to guard against unauthorized access to ePHI that is being transmitted over an electronic communications network.

children.title: Integrity Controls
children.description: Implement security measures to ensure that electronically transmitted ePHI is not improperly modified without detection until disposed of.

children.title: Encryption
children.description: Implement a mechanism to encrypt ePHI whenever deemed appropriate.

requirements.title: Organizational Requirements
requirements.description: Requirements related to business associate contracts and other arrangements.

children.title: Business Associate Contracts
children.description: The contract between a covered entity and a business associate must meet the requirements of the Security Rule.

children.title: Contract Requirements
children.description: The contract must require the business associate to comply with the applicable requirements of the Security Rule.

children.title: Reporting Requirements
children.description: The contract must require the business associate to report security incidents to the covered entity.

children.title: Requirements for Group Health Plans
children.description: A group health plan must ensure that its plan documents provide that the plan sponsor will reasonably and appropriately safeguard ePHI created, received, maintained, or transmitted.

children.title: Implementation Specifications
children.description: The plan documents must incorporate provisions to require the plan sponsor to implement administrative, physical, and technical safeguards.

requirements.title: Policies and Procedures and Documentation Requirements
requirements.description: Requirements for maintaining policies, procedures, and documentation.

children.title: Policies and Procedures
children.description: Implement reasonable and appropriate policies and procedures to comply with the standards, implementation specifications, or other requirements of the Security Rule.

children.title: Documentation
children.description: Maintain the policies and procedures implemented to comply with the Security Rule in written form.

children.title: Time Limit
children.description: Retain the documentation required for 6 years from the date of its creation or the date when it last was in effect, whichever is later.

children.title: Availability
children.description: Make documentation available to those persons responsible for implementing the procedures to which the documentation pertains.

children.title: Updates
children.description: Review documentation periodically, and update as needed, in response to environmental or operational changes affecting the security of ePHI.

requirements.title: Privacy Rule Administrative Requirements
requirements.description: Administrative requirements for the Privacy Rule.

children.title: Personnel Designations
children.description: A covered entity must designate a privacy official responsible for the development and implementation of the policies and procedures.

children.title: Training
children.description: A covered entity must train all members of its workforce on the policies and procedures with respect to PHI.

children.title: Safeguards
children.description: A covered entity must have in place appropriate administrative, technical, and physical safeguards to protect the privacy of PHI.

children.title: Complaints
children.description: A covered entity must provide a process for individuals to make complaints concerning the covered entity's policies and procedures.

children.title: Sanctions
children.description: A covered entity must have and apply appropriate sanctions against members of its workforce who fail to comply with the privacy policies and procedures.

children.title: Mitigation
children.description: A covered entity must mitigate, to the extent practicable, any harmful effect that is known to the covered entity of a use or disclosure of PHI in violation of its policies and procedures.

children.title: Refraining from Intimidating or Retaliatory Acts
children.description: A covered entity may not intimidate, threaten, coerce, discriminate against, or take other retaliatory action against any individual for exercising their rights under the Privacy Rule.

children.title: Waiver of Rights
children.description: A covered entity may not require individuals to waive their rights under the Privacy Rule as a condition of the provision of treatment, payment, enrollment in a health plan, or eligibility for benefits.

children.title: Policies and Procedures
children.description: A covered entity must implement policies and procedures with respect to PHI that are designed to comply with the Privacy Rule.

children.title: Documentation
children.description: A covered entity must maintain policies and procedures in written or electronic form and retain for six years.

requirements.title: Notice of Privacy Practices
requirements.description: Requirements for notice of privacy practices for PHI.

children.title: Notice Required
children.description: A covered entity must provide a notice that is written in plain language and that includes required elements.

children.title: Content of Notice
children.description: The notice must contain a header, description of uses and disclosures, individual rights, covered entity duties, and contact information.

children.title: Provision of Notice
children.description: A covered entity must make the notice available to any person who asks for it and must prominently post and make available a copy.

requirements.title: Access of Individuals to PHI
requirements.description: Individual's right to access their PHI.

children.title: Right of Access
children.description: An individual has a right of access to inspect and obtain a copy of PHI about the individual in a designated record set.

children.title: Request for Access
children.description: A covered entity must permit an individual to request access to inspect or obtain a copy of the PHI about the individual.

children.title: Provision of Access
children.description: A covered entity must provide the access requested by individuals, including the form and format requested.

children.title: Denial of Access
children.description: A covered entity may deny an individual access in certain circumstances and must provide a written denial.

requirements.title: Amendment of PHI
requirements.description: Individual's right to have PHI amended.

children.title: Right to Amend
children.description: An individual has the right to have a covered entity amend PHI or a record about the individual in a designated record set.

children.title: Request for Amendment
children.description: A covered entity must permit an individual to request that the covered entity amend the PHI.

children.title: Accepting the Amendment
children.description: If a covered entity accepts the requested amendment, it must make the amendment to the PHI or record.

children.title: Denying the Amendment
children.description: A covered entity may deny a requested amendment if it determines the PHI or record was not created by the covered entity.

requirements.title: Accounting of Disclosures of PHI
requirements.description: Individual's right to receive an accounting of disclosures of PHI.

children.title: Right to an Accounting
children.description: An individual has a right to receive an accounting of disclosures of PHI made by a covered entity in the six years prior to the date of the request.

children.title: Content of the Accounting
children.description: The accounting must include the date of disclosure, name of entity/person, brief description of PHI, and purpose of disclosure.

children.title: Provision of the Accounting
children.description: A covered entity must act on the individual's request for an accounting within 60 days.
